_header: Ye lords eke shining in noble fame
Title(s): Balade au tres honourable compaignie du Garter
_description: Thomas Hoccleve, Balade au tres honourable compaignie du Garter — four 8-line stanzas (same three rhymes throughout).

CamTCC595.First Lines:
The Lordes eke shynynge in noble fameTo whiche approued is the
                    mayntenance…
CamTCC595.Last Lines:
…Of whose vertue the myghtie haboundanceþou herte and
                    strength in faithful vnitee
CamTCC595.Note: Added to flyleaf by a hand of sixteenth century. Transcript from  Geoffrey Chaucer, Workes, Thynne, 1532  combined with 6299 as if one work in this MS.
CamTCC595.Attributed Title:
To the kinges moste noble grace and To the Lordes and Knightes of the
                    garter (f. 2)

HunHM111.First Lines:
Yee lordes eek shynyng in noble fameTo whiche appropred is the
                    maintenance…
HunHM111.Last Lines:
…Of whos vertu the mighty habundaunceYow herte & strengthe
                    in feithful vnitee
HunHM111.Facsimiles:
Burrow,  John,  and  A. I. Doyle, eds.  
             Thomas Hoccleve: A Facsimile of the Autograph Verse
                Manuscripts.
EETS
         s.s. 19 (2002).
